content.1: Now as touching things offered unto idols, we know that we all have knowledge. Knowledge puffeth up, but charity edifieth.
content.2: And if any man think that he knoweth any thing, he knoweth nothing yet as he ought to know.
content.3: But if any man love God, the same is known of him.

content.8: But meat commendeth us not to God: for neither, if we eat, are we the better; neither, if we eat not, are we the worse.
content.9: But take heed lest by any means this liberty of yours become a stumblingblock to them that are weak.
content.10: For if any man see thee which hast knowledge sit at meat in the idol’s temple, shall not the conscience of him which is weak be emboldened to eat those things which are offered to idols;
content.11: And through thy knowledge shall the weak brother perish, for whom Christ died?
content.12: But when ye sin so against the brethren, and wound their weak conscience, ye sin against Christ.
content.13: Wherefore, if meat make my brother to offend, I will eat no flesh while the world standeth, lest I make my brother to offend.
